club.seedymusic.jpa.dao

Class OrderDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • club.seedymusic.jpa.dao.OrderDAO

  • public class OrderDAO
extends java.lang.Object

    OrderDAO Class

    This class performs the Order related business logic for orders. It relies on the Order Entity Bean. It has a one-to-many relationship to a table listing the CD ids for a given order. This relies on the OrderItem Entity Bean and is part of a Set collection. Because the Hibernate mappings have been configured to do an "Eager" fetch of this joined table, no specific code / method is required to retrieve order items for an order other than simply retrieving the specific order itself.

    Version:
    Oct 9, 2017 Created this class.
    Author:
    Karim Sultan

    • Method Detail

      • createSession

        private org.hibernate.Session createSession()
        This method is a utility method for session creation, refactored from repetitive code.
        Returns:
        A Hibernate Session object to be used by transactions and queries.

      • addOrder

        public boolean addOrder(Order order)
        This method will add an order to the database. The order information must be stored in the Order Entity bean. Note that Order has a 1-to-Many relationship, as each order can contain multiple OrderItems (basically, the cdid).
        Parameters:
        order - - the Order entity bean, with associated OrderItem beans
        Returns:
        boolean; true if successful, false otherwise

      • listOrders

        public java.util.List<Order> listOrders()
        This will retrieve a list of ALL the Orders in the database. Once you have the list, you can iterate over the contents; each will be an entity bean with the database record stored in its attributes, accessible via the getter method accessors. NOTE: You will need to do a nested iteration over the OrderItems set contained within.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of all the Orders in the database which can be iterated over.

      • getOrder

        public Order getOrder(int id)
        Retrieves a single order object from the database based on its id.
        Parameters:
        id - The order id to retrieve from database.
        Returns:
        Returns the Order bean populated from db if id exists; null otherwise.

      • getCount

        public long getCount()
        Returns the number of records in the table.
        Returns:
        long Number of records

      • setStatus

        public boolean setStatus(int id,
                         java.lang.String status)
        Allows an order's status to be updated, based on a valid order id. Sanity checks aren't required on id and status as hibernate will throw an exception on failure.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the order to update.
        status - The new value for the status.
        Returns:
        Returns true on success, false otherwise
